title: Toy Story
body: Released in 1995, 'Toy Story' marked a new era in animation as the first full-length feature made entirely with computer-generated imagery. The film tells the story of Woody, a cowboy doll who feels threatened by the arrival of a new space action figure, Buzz Lightyear, in the room. As the two toys initially clash, they eventually learn to work together and form a strong friendship. The movie delves into themes of jealousy, competition, and the value of friendship. 'Toy Story' is also known for its clever humor, memorable characters, and its appeal to both children and adults. It paved the way for numerous sequels and spin-offs, establishing a beloved franchise.

title: Jumanji
body: The 1995 fantasy adventure film 'Jumanji', directed by Joe Johnston, is based on a 1981 children's book of the same name. The story revolves around a supernatural board game that releases jungle hazards into the real world with each roll of the dice. The protagonists, led by Robin Williams' character, must finish the game to reverse all the chaos it causes. 'Jumanji' is celebrated for its innovative special effects, thrilling plot, and engaging performances, particularly by Williams. The film explores themes of bravery, perseverance, and the impact of one's actions. It has since been followed by sequels and a related series, expanding its imaginative universe.
